noun.description: A pattern of intersecting straight lines or paths.
examples: the crisscross of wrinkles on his face

adjective.description: (of a pattern) containing a number of straight lines or paths that intersect each other.
examples: the streets ran in a regular crisscross pattern

adverb.description: In a pattern of intersecting straight lines.
examples: the swords were strung crisscross on his back

verb.description: Form a pattern of intersecting lines or paths on (a place)
examples: the green hill was crisscrossed with a network of sheep tracks
the smaller streets criss-crossed in a grid pattern

origin: Early 17th century (denoting a figure of a cross preceding the alphabet in a hornbook): from Christ-cross (in the same sense in late Middle English), from Christ's cross. The form was later treated as a reduplication of cross.
